name: Loews Portofino Bay Hotel at Universal Orlando

reviews.title: Nice hotel...but a really horrible surprise!
reviews.text: We decided to have a getaway weekend to Universal Studios last weekend (Jan 6-8). We decided to book the best reviewed hotel there--the Portofino Bay Hotel--which looked gorgeous! When we arrived it WAS beautiful and the service seemed great. The hotel was only 30% filled, so it was easy to get good service. The room was large and we did get the King Bed we asked for. We went off to City Walk for dinner and a night out which was close by. We returned to the room at 11:30 pm and I turned the sheets down (turn down service apparantly did not happen in our room!). Immediately I noticed large spots of blood all over the white sheets up near the pillow area. This was most definitely the most repulsive thing I've ever seen. We called the front desk, were put on hold for 15 min (keep in mind the hotel is NOT busy). Finally we were told that someone from housekeeping would be up to change the sheets. I said that it was disgusting to have to sleep in the bed that had dirty, bloody sheets and could we move? They said they had no rooms ready for us but they'd cover the bed well!!!! YUCK. ONE HOUR later the housekeeping team came up and started to remove the sheets. The head housekeeper made a repulsed face when he saw the blood and said "sorry for that!". Then they found out that they brought queen sheets so had to leave and get King sheets. Meanwhile, we're tired, want to sleep (so much for romance!) and it's now 1am!! Finally by 1:30 we get new sheets. IT's not a good sleep at all........

reviews.title: Would definitely return to Portofino
reviews.text: The next morning I went to the desk where they had a coupon for us for two mornings of free breakfasts for our bloody sheet incident(buffet only). I told them our flight was too early Sunday to use it and they said "oh, well...we'll credit your account $15 for your hassle.
Hassle?? Two hours to change sheets, no room change, the thought of WHY that blood was there, a miserable sleep.........and $15 off my bill...which was $329 per nite??
reviews.title: We were quite pleased - a beautiful place

reviews.text: I thought the hotel was gorgeous........but their cleanliness might be an issue.............
reviews.title: Pretty, but looks can be deceiving
not good
reviews.text: The positive reviews of the Portofino outweighed the negative reviews, so I felt comfortable booking this hotel. The things most people talking about like being far from everything and having to walk far weren't a concern to me.
I was drawn to this hotel simply because I know the "real" Portofino quite well.
reviews.title: Excellent but pricey

reviews.text: The replica in Orlando as viewed from the water is stunning and a lot of effort has clearly gone into the property.
reviews.title: July Too Hot & Humid
Perfect Honeymoon at Portofino
reviews.text: Positives
* Great room
reviews.title: Some great points, some awful

likes.liked: — The design of the hotel, a small part of Italy in the USA
likes.disliked: — Although honeymooning we were treated as 2nd class tourists upon arrival

reviews.text: * Proximity to Universal & the water taxi service
reviews.title: GREAT!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Portofino Bay hotel for 2 nights during a recent stay in Orlando. We had a standard view room with a small balcony overlooking a small wooded area. The room was very nice, it was clean and large.
reviews.title: Great resort, but not worth the extra cost over the other Universal Resorts

reviews.text: They have singers perform from a balcony overlooking the bay every night. The singers were really good. They performed for about 20-30 minutes, and sang a combination of recognizable Italian songs, and songs like "Fly Me To The Moon." They are definitely worth seeing if you are at the resort at night.
reviews.title: A taste of Italy - and an oasis of class and calm - in the midst of Universal Studios Orlando.

reviews.text: While the resort was beautiful to walk around, and the pool was very nice, I did not think it was worst the extra cost when compared to the other Universal resorts (The Hard Rock Hotel--which would have been about $70 cheaper per night and the Royal Pacific Resort--Wich would have been about $90 cheaper per night). The other resorts are closer to the parks, and the rooms are just as nice. The grounds at the Portofino Bay may be more beautiful, but unless you are planning on spending a large amount of time at the resort, I would save the money and stay at one of the other resorts. Your room will be just as nice.
reviews.title: One of our best family vacations spent here
The saying "You get what you pay for" does not apply here.
reviews.text: My 10 year old daughter and I spent a glorious week at the Loews Portofino Bay Resort in Orlando. From the minute we arrived (to a warm and inviting welcome by the valet) until the last valet closed the door to the car as we headed back to the airport, we were treated with grace, warmth, and exceptional service. The hotel itself is reminiscent of Venice, with beautiful frescoes and warmly hued, shuttered buildings set around a piazza with restaurants and shops, all overlooking a stunning harbor, dotted with boats. The piazza is serene, a respite from the bustling parks, and a welcome start and finish to one's days!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at noon and our room was ready for us. It was located in the West Wing, with a water view, just steps away from the water taxi that takes you to the theme parks. I'd recommend this building for families who intend to head to the park early or those who don't want to walk too far. The other side wasn't that far, but this building was just a hop skip and a jump from the water taxi and close to the "kid's" pool.
reviews.title: Parks are a boat ride away

reviews.text: This is an in depth review of our 4 night stay from Oct 30 through Nov 3 at the Portofino. My boyfriend and I are both in our late 40's and enjoyed this trip without the children or pets ! I want to thank all the other TripAdvisor travelers who have shared their experiences. Whether good or bad, everyone comes with different expectations and therefore come away with very different opinions on the same place. For those of you planning a possible trip here, I will try to be as detailed as possible.
reviews.title: Our taste of Italy - ala Portofino !
Portofino Bay Resort
reviews.text: CHECK - IN : We arrived at 11:30am to find our room not yet available. Ruby at the front reception was extremely helpful. Being a Loew's First member, I inquired about the free upgrade. I was eligible for a deluxe room but turned it down. We had requested (months earlier) a Bayview King room with a terrace in the West wing. If I accepted the upgrade, I would not get those options. The hotel put our baggage into storage and took my cell number for contact. The call came a couple of hours later and when we finished at the park, we went to our room. My Loew's first complimentary water and fruit was in our room by evening.

THE ROOM : Beautiful! Room 3153 in the west wing was less than a minute from the water taxi's and we had a lovely patio accessed by french doors where we enjoyed coffee every morning. My boyfriend is a smoker so the patio was a bonus for him. The bathroom was huge and well stocked.Robes are provided. And the bed, heaven! Very, very comfortable - tons of pillows! The room is equipped with a coffee maker. We took the advice of some other guests and purchased a styrofoam cooler along with some coffee creamer, water and other goodies on our way to the hotel. The ice machine was a couple of doors down. We left a tip every morning ($5) along with whatever requests we had. Room was always made up by 2pm and everything was replenished to our satisfaction. Note: We had no need for the minibar and did not take the key at check-in.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: RESTAURANTS: We ate at 3 of the Portofino's locations. Sal's makes the most delicious pizza! It didn't sink in until our 3rd visit to buy 1 large pie and split the toppings! The large is 8 slices and will more than satisfy 2 people. Breakfast at the Trattoria in the early morning out on the plaza overlooking the bay was simply so relaxing...the food, while not cheap was excellent and served graciously. As it has been stated before, don't expect to pay motel prices for food at a 4 star hotel. Coffee for 2 , a hot breakfast wrap with a side of potatoes and pancakes with bacon was $28 plus tip. We enjoyed dinner at Mama Della's one evening and it was delicious. My boyfriend had the ravioli with vodka sauce and I had chicken marsala with angel hair pasta. No desserts as the meal was quite filling.The bill was in the $60 range before tip. We never tried room service and enjoyed our other meals at the parks and Citywalk. On our last morning, we strolled to the Hard Rock and had breakfast there. Excellent food and do you know, they even have rock music playing in the restrooms??!!
reviews.title: Excellent Overall Experience

reviews.text: AMENITIES: For this time of year, the Beach pool was relatively quiet so we had no need to venture further. Towels are provide, there are cabanas, and the hottub was fantastic! My boyfriend even tried the slide a few times and had a blast! Staff will come around with menu's for the poolside snack place. The only downside was we went to play air hockey in the game room and it took our money but no puck! For $1, I wasn't going to make a big deal. I needed to buy emergency aspirin and one of the hotel stores was open at 7am but a word of advice - bring plenty from home! We relaxed in the lounge off the main lobby which had a lovely terrace overlooking the plaza and bay. Water taxi's are the way to go - we never had to wait longer than 5 minutes 99% of the time. Only time we had a longer wait was one night when it rained and was quite cool...semed to take forever but it was probably due to the weather. We rented one movie from the room. $12 plus tax. You can check your account status from your room and we did so daily to keep track of charges. Only one error and it was corrected immediately.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but lacking in service finesse

reviews.text: First time there...was given a lovely room with a view of the bay.
reviews.title: Yes it's worth it

reviews.text: Loved going to Universal via boat. Staff is top notch, pizza at deli the best I've ever had. People have mentioned a longer walk or boat ride, but I can't imagine staying anywhere else. The express passes more than make up the difference of staying off site, especially during busy times.
reviews.title: Fantasy escape to Italy, worth the extra cost
Portofino Dece,ber 2012
reviews.text: Wish I had time to check out the pool, but spend almost all the time at the parks.
Missed the complimentary coffee in the lobby, but the Keurig machine worked fine.
reviews.title: Convenient and Front of the Line Pass for Universal

reviews.text: Due to limitations at the other two hotels, we spent $100 more than planned on a club queen room for 5 of us. This was totally worth the upgrade. We had access to the club lounge which provides you access to a modest yet fulfilling selection of foods and drinks at breakfast, lunch, dinner, and nightly dessert. The dinner items were small appetizers that included beer and wine and sodas. The 5 of us easily drank and ate over $100 of items as opposed to buying pizza in the parks for $100. The pool was excellent and a movie was shown at night by the pool. An excellent choice to stay here, but do not stay here if over 85% of your day will be at the parks. We split our time and stayed at the hotel 33% on check in day and 20% on check out day.
reviews.title: Suspend belief and this is as good as the real thing

reviews.text: Glossy on the outside but lacks warmth and friendliness on the inside. The concierge staff were unhelpful and the waiters in mamma dellas just plain nasty. Our holiday lasted 14 nights and after 7 nights the numbers in the hotel dropped significantly this resulted in the breakfast buffet being removed a pool closing and also a restaurant closing even though we had paid the same rate for every night. Some requests were just ignored and a small number of items went missing from our rooms including some medication.
reviews.title: not worth the money

reviews.text: We vacationed this year at Universal Studios and stayed at the Portofino Bay Hotel. It was marvelous! The beach pool was very impressive for both kids and adults. The rooms were large and the decor of "Italy" is tastfully done. Some of the on-site retaurants were a little pricey, but the food was good. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved The Portofino Bay!

likes.liked: — The waterway access to Universal Studios!

reviews.text: PS - If you plan to go to Universal Studios, you must stay on the property for the on-site property hotel key allows you to jump in line at all rides! The longest we waited for a ride was 7 minutes. I would highly recommend staying on Universal property for this reason alone~~
reviews.title: Loved it, Guess that's Why I Stayed here twice!

likes.disliked: — Far walk from elevators to rooms (not a big deal)

reviews.text: I really love this place. The architecture alone is incredible. The staff is super friendly. The facilities are immaculately kept. This place is huge and even staying here two times wasnt enough to discover all that it offers. First off, when you pull up to the lobby you are greeted by someone who will park your car (valet service) or you can park on your own. Check-in is a breeze and the staff is SUPER friendly. I stayed here with my son and he received a kids welcome basket. Our card keys were used to get access to Universal Express lines. That alone was worth it! We took the boat over to Universal everyday. So convenient. We stayed in the deluxe room. The rooms are big, especially for the two of us. We got the two queen beds. The bathroom is really big with a separate tub and a nice standup shower, double sink with huge counter room. There are shutter windows by the tub that lead into the bedroom and my son would jump thru them right onto his bed. Cute. Turn down service at night. The rooms are kept spotless and very clean!! My favorite thing here would have to be the room service! Expensive but delicious! I recommend this at least ONE morning. Again, service, service, service. So top notch. I love staying here!
reviews.title: Great Rooms but below average customer service

likes.liked: — Express Pass with the room key to universal theme parks
likes.disliked: — Customer Service at the front desk

reviews.text: My first impression of the resort was check-in. This was not a positive experience. We arrived at 5:00 p.m. There was 2 people behind the check-in counter when I first arrived and I was 2nd in line. I expected this to be a speedy check-in. I was wrong. One of the employees disappeared. I was in line for about 35 to 40 mins. This was not pleasant with 2 small children. I thought that I would at least get an apology at the check in counter when it was finally my turn. I was wrong. He was not even very friendly. Customer service here compared to the Disney resorts was very poor. Also had miscommunication with front desk about picking up package.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel
loved this hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the portifino bay for 3 nights We loved it. IT was a little more expensive but well worth it.The staff (all of them)were very nice.We ate at the resturants and the food was very good.Access to front of the lines at the parks very helpful with children.No problems what soever.

OVERVIEW: My husband and I stayed at the Portofino Bay 11/24/05-11/28/05. I have to say that the staff members seem to be the happiest people I have ever seen all in one place. Typically if you travel, shop, or dine out you come in contact with a nice person or two, but here, everyone is polite and happy to help you. It was a little surreal, especially as they were working on a holiday. Keep in mind that smiling and being polite goes long way, but the actual delivery of what is stated can be something completely different.
reviews.title: Portofino Bay Stay

reviews.text: THE NOT SO GOOD: For the most part, they were accommodating. I had requested a Bay View room, near main lobby, foam pillows (allergies to down feathers)and as a LoewsFirst member, the local paper and fruit and water at check in. We got a Bay View room way over on the west wing. It was hard to see the plaza from the room, but we were near the water taxi. I had called twice to confirm my requests prior to vacation, and they said they had them. They also said they could see them on my reservation when I went down to the front desk to ask about why the requested items were not there. They said they were trying to get the pillows, (we got them later that night before we went to bed), and they were working on the other things. As for the room, I asked about the one near the lobby as requested, one reservationist said they didn't have any, the other said they did, but we ended up staying where we were. That night -the people next to us came in and sounded like they were in our room with us. They were very loud, maybe because it was an adjoining room. It was odd, because you couldn't hear much of anything going on outside where the boat came in and out, but the guests next store were horribly loud. After all the other things, my husband went down to the front desk to complain about our neighbors. They said they would "talk to them" and ask them to keep it down and if that didn't work, we could move down the hall. The party quieted down a little while later, so we were satified. Again- everyone was very polite. Friday morning, went to get my local paper in the hallway- The New York Times was there. When I called down to the front desk, the lady said, "we don't get the local paper on weekdays". Monday morning- the local Orlando paper appeared. Ask, and you shall receive. Again- very polite and empathetic. We had 2 souvenir wine glasses from the Harbor Nights Festivities as well as one of the rooms wine glasses disappear after the maid had cleaned the room. We contacted housekeeping as the maid said she didn't understand English, and they did find two souvenir glasses and brought them to our room a few hours later. Very polite, and very nice. Maids should pay more attention to detail- no soap to shower with and the mirror had dried water spots on a lot of it, coffee in room one day was only decaf. The hotel also does put a $300 hold on your card above and beyond the room rates when you check in for "incidentals and room charges" which can crimp your spending if you use a bank card. Pools were cold and had a lot of leaves in them although-it had been windy there. Coffee shop closes in the afternoon until 4PM. We wanted to get coffee a few times during the day there and sit out and look at the bay, but couldn't. Lots of walking to get to your room especially in the West Wing. You have to go from the lobby-down the elevator- outside across the plaza-into the building- up the elevator to find your room. It can be overwhelming at first if you've never been there, but you get used to it.
reviews.title: Looks are not everything

reviews.text: THE GOOD: Room and bathroom were very nice. Turn-down service nice feature. Harbor Night-unexpectedly fantastic. We didn't even know they were having a live band playing Sinatra-type tunes with horns and the works. It costs $25.00 per person and you can sample all the different restaurants foods (cooked right in front of you), wines and they even had free cigars and cigar rolling, outside at night in the plaza decorated for Christmas and celebrating the tree lighting! It was excellent, but I think they only did it as a special event. Internet access -nice feature for a fee- to print our boardings passes and check-in online so we didn't have to at the airport. Villa pool, nice secret place to relax. I think it was my favorite. Place was relatively clean all the time. (I did see one leftover wine glass sit on the table near the elevator for a day or so). At night, the workers go around like little elves to make the place look new again for morning visitors. They also are constantly picking things up and cleaning during the day. Coffee shop has alot of great items and you can grab something quick in the morning if you are in a hurry to get to the parks. Water taxi is a real plus. Using your room key to get into the rides without waiting-priceless. Motion sensors in the room let housekeeping know when you are away so they can clean it without disturbing you. Pretty cool, huh? Overall design of the hotel and decor- beautiful. From the piped in Italian music to the mosaic details, it was very well thought out. Check it out-and remember- ask here and you shall receive.
reviews.title: Nothing but the best!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The hotel is very pretty and very quiet.
reviews.title: Not a great stay

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for two nights a few years ago. My work had an incentive program where they rewarded good employees with a very nice long weekend trip for two to different locations each year. Everything was booked by them and I was not dissapointed at all with this hotel. The room was very clean and service was excellent. The food at their restaurants was also above average. Your room key is also used as a speed pass on all the rides in Universal so there is no wait. You will get on every ride within minutes. After a while you might feel quilty walking past all the people who don't have the pass standing in line for hours. The hotel has a small ferry boat that you dock at the hotel and it brings you right to the park. This really is a very nice hotel but way out of my price range. I would never stay here again simply because of the $300 a night rate. If you have the money to stay here then you will definitely like this hotel and all it offers.
reviews.title: Very nice but also very expensive
really relaxing and peaceful
reviews.text: Went for 8 nights before xmas break. Totally relaxing for those who want to escape the madness of Orlando. Stayed in kids suite - not cheap but worth the extra. Better rate than anywhere else by going on their official website and got really good deal on the park tickets on their site- 14 days admission for the price of two to universal/islands of adventure. The fast pass is worth it's weight in gold only available with your room key. Luxury surroundings and fab at xmas with all the carol singers and singers on the balcony. Pizza at the deli is best ever and the steakhouse at the Hard Rock was very good. Mama Dellas is just OK but nothing special. Can be a long walk if you are in the east wing to the boat which is very punctual. Always seemed very quiet and the pool by the east wing is deserted if you want privacy. Have stayed here twice and if we ever return to Orlando will stay here again. We got a taxi here from airport which was 40 dollars and didn't bother with a car for over a week as you don't need one if you stay here. Unreservedly recommend this hotel.

Beautiful Hotel with the best staff. On our honeymoon we were at the Portofino for 3 days in mid September and had a fantastic time. We arrived late at 10pm on the first night and check in clerk Laura– immediately set the tone for our stay – engaging, friendly, polite and professional and as honeymooner’s a complimentary bottle of wine was sent to the room (and it was a good one). I don’t know where they get their staff or how they train them but they are amongst the brightest and helpful I have come across and it is what makes the difference between a really good hotel and a great one. This is a great one. At 10.30pm we still managed to get a Pizza in Sal’s and returned to our room. The room was large with a massive king-size bed – the type you need a step ladder to get into. The bathroom was large with twin sinks however the robes were a bit light. The guest wings on the first floor were undergoing complete refurbishment during our stay – so maybe some of the earlier reviews had a point. Our room had already been refurbished (3rd floor) so everything was new – the corridors still smelt of new carpets. The corridors are long but you have to understand it is based on a real town and consists of two long guest wings with the restaurants, bars etc in the middle. We ate at Bice’s one night and it has the wow factor – beautifully designed and furnished – we decided to sit on the balcony over looking the square – which was very romantic as night fell in and the lights come on all over the square. The bill while pricey ($230 for 4 course meal with wine and aperitifs – beware the Ice Martini’s are $25 – not including tip) but the food and service were excellent and it is 5 star all the way. Mama Della’s however was a bit of a disappointment for us as a couple, the food was just ok and the waitress that fake sweet – sorry. Breakfast and Lunch in Trattoria were great – dine al fresco if you like. The water taxis to the theme parks are a real perk and such an elegant way to travel. In all we had a fabulous time – enjoyed all the hotel has to offer – and would fully recommend anyone to stay here – it‘s good value for money. Best Thing: the space. Worst thing: both the Hard Rock and Royal Pacific exit off Universal boulevard were well signposted but they forgot about the Portofino exit so the entrance is just there all of a sudden! …break … whoops missed it …….round again.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon
Looks lovely, however!
reviews.text: As stated before by other guests, it looks stunnig from the outside, however the cleanless of the room left a lot to be desires for a 5 star hotel, it was less than clean, carpet dirty, table top sticky, bathroom left with hairs etc, and to top it all the comment card was also dirty! so folks lovely to look at but needs some attention to cleaning!

reviews.title: Wonderful, Elegant and a perfect honeymoon!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Portofino Bay Hotel for our honeymoon and loved every moment!

This hotel is lack luster. At first you experience the oooh's and ahhh's until you look a little closer and realize that all of the "architecture" is painted on. Also, because this is set up like an Italian village, it is wide, not tall and you have to walk insanely far to your room. The beds are wonderful, though. We had a problem with neither of our room keys working. They weren't working because the locks battery was dead, and we told them that. We called from our neighbors room and asked someone to bring us new keys and the front desk said "Come down and get new keys, try them and come back down if they don't work." We said No because that is ridiculous, it is so far and the battery is dead in the lock. Plus we were leaving. They said that they would leave the keys at Concierge for when we get back. We got back and Concierge had no clue about our keys. Very Frustrating. The food in the hotel is very very expensive. I will not stay here again.
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.text: Check in was average as were the staff in general.
reviews.title: Unmissable if you are visiting the Universal parks.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was surprisingly small (expected more as I'd booked this in preference to the other 2 hotels because it is supposed to have the largest rooms) but fine.
reviews.title: Couldn't be better

likes.liked: — Pristine, clean, beautifully furnished & great views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The external aspects of the hotel were nice - good pools and the Portofino Bay appearance was well done. Boat shuttle to Universal worked well (as did the alternative of a cycle rickshaw).
reviews.title: Heaven sent, with an Angel named Lisa ( Front Desk )

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the clincher is the Express Pass access to Universal attractions. You can buy an Express Pass for $19.95 but that only gives you priveleged access to each ride ONCE!!
reviews.title: Fantastic - would stay here again and again

reviews.text: We selected this hotel because of the Italian theme and because guests of the hotel get early entry and line skip benefits at the Universal parks. We were not disappointed as the hotel theme is beautifully carried out, and the food is great. The pizza at the deli really is very good and the lasagne at Mama Della's was fabulous. The opera singers are a nice touch each evening as well. The staff is very polite including the front desk folks, concierge, housekeeping and security guards. The hotel is clean and the rooms and beds are comfortable. My only caution about this hotel would be to provide this awareness. If you are considering upgrading to the bay view rooms be aware that very few rooms have a balcony. We were fortunate and had one though it was shared with the next room. So, even if you have one, it might not be private. Other than that it really is a great hotel. Oh and the room with 2 queen beds also has a twin size pull out sofa/chair.
reviews.title: Great themed hotel

reviews.text: the common areas are stunning, but the experience was not perfect.
reviews.title: mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the pros; great location, nice view if you get lake view rooms as we did, early admission to the wizarding world of Harry Potter, clean hotel, nice rooms, pleasant staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful! Like a weekend to Italy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the cons; no turn down service, staff poorly trained at reception, no internet in room during all my stay there- 8 days!!-loud and poor breakfast , have n seen one piece of cheese during my whole stay!
reviews.title: Harry Potter trip--by older people, no kids

reviews.text: My initial stay at this hotel was because I won an award from my company. They wined and dined us throughout so it was magnificent!
reviews.title: Fantastico !

reviews.text: We knew that we were stretching the vacation budget to stay at the Portofino but we figured that we would have no additional charges for our 3 children. Unfortunately the "Stay, Play, Eat Free is bogus!" About two of the Park Restaurants accept it, and all they give is a small bowl of Maccoroni & Cheese or some other item that your kid will never eat. The rooms were adequate but you are not allowed to put any item in the room's fridge without a $20 daily service charge. Sure it's a beautiful hotel but you will quickly become disgusted with the "ripoff" aspect of the experience. Be prepared to have your final bill be almost double the booking price (because everything from food to souvenirs is priced quite insanely). Final Room and Food bill for a family of 5 will average $700+ per day.
reviews.title: Kids Stay, Play & Eat Free is a farce!

likes.liked: — Location to Universal Studios is great.
likes.disliked: — Unexpected daily charges and outrageous food / drink costs.

reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Portofino Bay Hotel in July 2006 and had a nice time overall but spent a small fortune. (The weekend cost us about 3 grand for 4 adults - two rooms - that did include a visit to the Spa) Don't expect 4 or 5 star service at this hotel - its basically 2 star service with 4 star surroundings.
reviews.title: Way Overpriced, but a nice way to visit Universal Florida
Best place for teenagers wanting Universal Parks
reviews.text: Overall this place is really beautiful and has all of the "hardware" of a 4 or 5 star hotel - nice rooms with high-thread count sheets, nice toiletries and picturesque lakeside setting and italian theme.

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!
reviews.text: The food at the restaraunts was of a very good quality but the service was extremely slow - stay far away from the trattoria if you are in a hurry. The servers at breakfast were either extremely rude or just hungover from partying on Saturday night. The servers at lunch were just confused in general as to the menu and how to handle the cash register.

reviews.title: Loved this hotel
reviews.text: Housekeeping was good - when they came. We didn't have our rooms serviced until late in the day which made for an awkward waste of about 2 hours in the middle of the day when we wanted to use our rooms. Turndown service didn't happen on one of the two nights.

My family and I arrived after a 9-hr flight from Brazil. Check-in person, Renée, said no one could show us to our rooms, the choice was to go look for them ourselves and wait for the luggage to arrive. She said it was a very large hotel and started giving us instructions how to find our rooms.
reviews.title: All right only. Too big, check-in person was not nice at all.

reviews.text: Fortunately, a nice bellman went with us, as we would never had found the way by ourselves.
reviews.title: Only positive is early access to the parks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Concierge was nice, with Miss Wise.
reviews.title: Beautiful property, wonderful staff, thin walls

reviews.text: Restaurants ok. People tried to be nice. Room service ok.
reviews.title: stunning!

reviews.text: Does not compare to inside-Disney hotels. Paid for internet service but it did not work all the time.
reviews.title: Really run down over the years

description: Celebrate la dolce vita — the sweet life — at Loews Portofino Bay Hotel at Universal Orlando®. Located at Universal Orlando® Resort, this luxurious hotel re-creates the charm and romance of the famed seaside village of Portofino, Italy, right down to the cobblestone streets and outdoor cafes. Hotel guests enjoy spacious guest rooms featuring authentic Italian furnishings, impeccable and attentive service, an opulent spa, three themed swimming pools and exceptional dining. Hotel guests also enjoy an exclusive package of theme park benefits, including: * Early Park Admission† to The Wizarding World of Harry Potter™, one hour before the theme park opens (valid theme park admission required)* Universal Express ride access* to skip the regular lines throughout both theme parks - a FREE benefit worth up to $87 per person, per day (valid theme park admission required)* Complimentary water taxis or shuttle buses to make getting around the resort fast and easy so you can make the most of your time * And more.
